result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chai Thao

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chai Thao in court via audio.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Chai Thao.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Defense has discovery and an offer, requesting an additional status to allow time to review discovery. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 36, Judge Davis. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 36.

Defendant Chai Thao in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status of counsel hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant regarding defense counsel appointment. CASE PASSED.

Case RECALLED at 10:19 AM. Defendant Chai Thao in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Chai Thao.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Michael Plaisted, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at October 1st, 2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chai Thao in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status of counsel.  Defendant requests additional time to retain At22cf1733ty Michael Hayes.  Court scheduled a status of counsel date.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chai Thao in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Status Conference. Defendant informed the court that he has retained Attorney Michael Hayes. Court advised defendant to provide attorney with new court date. Case adjourned, Branch 38. **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chai Thao in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Status Conference. Defendant request additional time to retain counsel. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Chai Thao in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued. Defendant needs time to retain counsel. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Chai Thao in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Indigency hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court orders bench warrant to issue for the defendant.  The Court ordered that the defendant is to be REMANDED to the trial court upon return on the bench warrant.  The Court ordered any bail on deposit forfeited.
Indigency hearing on May 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Chai Thao in court, appear by video.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Chai Thao in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/05/2022@02:00

22RM016934 Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
3/29/2022
